title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4002.7 - Term of license
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4002.7 - Term of license

State Regulations

Each such license, unless revoked for cause, shall be
for the period of no more than one, two or three years, expiring on the
applicant's birth date, as prescribed by Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and

Breeding Law section 220(1). A renewal license for owner, trainer, assistant
trainer, jockey, jockey agent, racing official, mutuel employee, maintenance
employee of the New York Racing Association, Inc., veterinarian, veterinary
technician, farrier, track management or track security employee shall be for
three years unless an individual establishes good cause for a shorter term or
the commission, in the commission's discretion, determines a shorter
term. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4002.7

Amended

New

York State Register February 10, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 06, eff. 2/10/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
